intro: Listrostachys muansae, commonly known as the Muansae spurge, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
